      • getResetTokenTtlHours

        public int getResetTokenTtlHours()
        Description copied from interface: PasswordPolicy
        Return the time-to-live (in hours) for the reset password token.
        Specified by:

      • setResetTokenTtlHours

        public PasswordPolicy setResetTokenTtlHours(int resetTokenTtl)
        Description copied from interface: PasswordPolicy
        Specifies the amount of time (in hours) that a reset token will remain valid. Once that time has passed, the token gets invalidated.

        Defaults to 24 hrs. Must be a positive integer, less than 169 (i.e. 0 < resetTokenTtl < 169). 168 hours equals 7 days.

        Specified by:
        setResetTokenTtlHours in interface PasswordPolicy
        Parameters:
        resetTokenTtl - how long (in hours) a reset token can remain active until it is used.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • getResetEmailStatus

        public EmailStatus getResetEmailStatus()
        Description copied from interface: PasswordPolicy
        Returns the Reset Email's status.

        An disabled indicates that the Reset Password Workflow is disabled. Therefore, the reset email will not be sent to the account trying to reset its password.

        Specified by:
        getResetEmailStatus in interface PasswordPolicy
        Returns:
        the Reset Email's status.

      • setResetEmailStatus

        public PasswordPolicy setResetEmailStatus(EmailStatus status)
        Description copied from interface: PasswordPolicy
        Specifies whether the Reset Email Workflow is enabled or disabled for the parent directory. When disabled, the reset email will not be sent to the account trying to reset its password.
        Specified by:
        setResetEmailStatus in interface PasswordPolicy
        Parameters:
        status - the status of the Reset Email Workflow
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • getResetSuccessEmailStatus

        public EmailStatus getResetSuccessEmailStatus()
        Description copied from interface: PasswordPolicy
        Returns the Reset Success Email's status.

        An disabled indicates that the Reset Success Password Workflow is disabled. Therefore, the reset success email will not be sent to the account after resetting its password.

        Specified by:
        getResetSuccessEmailStatus in interface PasswordPolicy
        Returns:
        the Reset Success Email's status.

      • setResetSuccessEmailStatus

        public PasswordPolicy setResetSuccessEmailStatus(EmailStatus status)
        Description copied from interface: PasswordPolicy
        Specifies whether the Reset Success Email Workflow is enabled or disabled for the parent directory. When disabled, the success email will not be sent to the account after resetting its password.
        Specified by:
        setResetSuccessEmailStatus in interface PasswordPolicy
        Parameters:
        status - the status of the Reset Success Email Workflow
        Returns:
